newsitem.title: USA: CSCE world sugar called to open little changed.
newsitem.headline: CSCE world sugar called to open little changed.

text.p: CSCE world sugar was called to open mostly unchanged on Monday, with prices seen consolidating sharp gains made during the previous session, dealers said.

Heavy fund buying in the nearby months fueled prices sharply higher on Friday. Benchmark July rose 0.21 cent a lb to close at 11.09 cents, after touching a high of 11.18 cents. The spot May contract rallied 0.33 cent to close at 11.29.
The day's volume was heavy at an estimated 43,366 lots.
The last trading day for the spot-May contract is April 30.
On the charts, resistance was pegged at 11.18 basis July, traders said.
China's State Statistical Bureau said it produced 4.112 million tonnes of sugar in the first three months of 1997, up 13.6 percent from the same year-ago period.
LIFFE white sugar futures were mixed on Monday, with August up $1.20 to $310.40, at 0845 EDT/1345 GMT.
((-- S Rostler New York Commodity Desk, 212-859-1640))
